integer_coders module

class integer_coders.UniversalUintDecoder

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataDecoder

Universal Encoding: 0 -> 100 1 -> 101 2 -> 11010 3 -> 11011 4 -> 1110100 (1110 + 100) … NOTE: not the most efficient but still “universal”

decode_block(bitarray: utils.bitarray_utils.BitArray)

abstract function to decode one encoded_bitarray

subclassing decoders mainly need to only implement this function.

Parameters

bitarray (BitArray) – input encoded bitarray

Returns

returns the decoded data and how many bits were used the num_bits_consumed can be used appropriately if the encoded bitarray contains encoded bits from more than one encoders

Return type

decoded_block (DataBlock), num_bits_consumed (int)

decode_symbol(encoded_bitarray)

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataEncoder

Universal Encoding: 0 -> 100 1 -> 101 2 -> 11010 3 -> 11011 4 -> 1110100 (1110 + 100) … NOTE: not the most efficient but still “universal”

encode_block(data_block: core.data_block.DataBlock)

Abstract class to encode a given block of data

Subclassing encoders need to mainly implement this method

Parameters

data_block (DataBlock) – input data_block

Returns

the encoded bitarray

Return type

encoded_bitarray (BitArray)
